intro: Palicourea mapiriensis, commonly known as the Mapiri shrub, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in Venezuela and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a slightly rough texture. Palicourea mapiriensis is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
